description: Write n and 2n in binary and add them mod 2.
comments: Reversing binary representation of -n. Converting sum of powers of 2 in binary representation of a(n) to alternating sum gives -n. Note that the alternation is applied only to the nonzero bits and does not depend on the exponent of two. All integers have a unique reversing binary representation (see cited exercise for proof).
